intro: Olsynium trinerve, commonly known as the three-veined olsynium, is a species of flowering plant in the family Acanthaceae. It is native to tropical regions of Africa, particularly in countries like Kenya and Tanzania. The plant is characterized by its slender, upright stems and opposite, lance-shaped leaves with three distinct veins. Its small, tubular flowers are typically pink or purple and are clustered in whorls along the stems. Olsynium trinerve is often found in moist, shaded habitats such as forest understories and rocky outcrops.
